title: Massive demand for new vehicles continues despite soaring price
byline: Vehicle sellers in Sri Lanka are currently grappling with an overwhelming demand for new vehicles, despite the persistently high prices of imported units, the Vehicle Importers’ Association of Sri Lanka (VIASL) President Prasad Manage said.

title: AKD warns of using two-thirds majority to amend laws if mandate is challenged or disrupted
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake yesterday said the government will amend laws if someone challenges and tries to disrupt the mandate, while claiming that National People’s Power (NPP) has the right to form councils in local bodies where the NPP has secured a majority as per the mandate.

title: Kagenthini wins Sri Lanka’s first Bronze Medal
byline: Kagenthini Loganathan, a talented pugilist from Vavuniya, clinched the first bronze medal for Sri Lanka at the ASBC Asian Under-22 and Youth Championships being held at the Sugathadasa Stadium in Colombo.

title: Govt auctioning 26 vehicles including Porsche, BMW
byline: A total of 26 vehicles, including luxury and decommissioned models, are to be auctioned today by the Presidential Secretariat.

title: At least 21 killed in crash in Mexico, official says
byline: At least 21 people have been killed in a road accident in central Mexico, according to a local official.

title: Balochs declare independence from Pakistan
byline: Baloch nationalist leaders have declared independence from Pakistan, citing decades of violence, enforced disappearances, and human rights violations in the region.

title: Mexican beauty influencer shot to death during TikTok livestream
byline: A 23-year-old influencer was shot and killed on Tuesday at a beauty salon in Jalisco, Mexico, while she was livestreaming on TikTok, according to the state prosecutor’s office.

title: Pubudu Dassanayake appointed USA men’s head coach
byline: USA Cricket has appointed former Sri Lanka wicketkeeper, Pubudu Dassanayake, as the head coach of the men’s national team.

title: SC integrates GovPay, advancing legal system digitalization
byline: Marking a significant milestone in the digital transformation of Sri Lanka’s legal system, the Supreme Court (SC) today inaugurated its integration with GovPay, the government’s digital payment platform.

title: Former Land Reclamation Chairman granted bail in Rs. 27.6 Mn case
byline: Former Chairman of the Land Reclamation and Development Corporation, Prasad Harshan De Silva, was arrested today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption in connection with the alleged misappropriation of Rs. 27.6 million.

title: Govt Analyst, DMT officials inspect Gerandi Ella ill-fated bus
byline: The Government Analyst and officials from the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) inspected the ill fated bus that claimed 23 lives of passengers in Gerandi Ella, Ramboda last week.

title: U.S. provides $1M worth of nuclear detection gear to Sri Lanka Navy
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka has provided state-of-the-art radiation and chemical detection equipment valued at $1 million (299 million LKR) to the Sri Lanka Navy, significantly boosting the country’s capacity to detect and respond to nuclear, radiological, and chemical threats in its maritime domain.

title: Trump says India willing to charge ’no tariffs’ on US goods
byline: US President Donald Trump has said that India has offered to drop all tariffs on goods imported from his country.

title: Kusal Mendis to replace Buttler at GT for IPL playoffs
byline: Sri Lanka wicketkeeper-batter Kusal Mendis will replace Jos Buttler in the Gujarat Titans squad for the IPL playoffs.

title: Two Sri Lankan entrepreneurs shine on Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia list
byline: Sri Lanka celebrates a key milestone as two of its young  and emerging entrepreneurs  Yanika Amarasekera-Siyaguna and Charith N Silva, have been named to the prestigious Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia 2025 list.

title: Putin and Zelensky to skip Ukraine peace talks
byline: Neither Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky nor Russian President Vladimir Putin will take part in the first direct Ukraine peace talks since 2022, dampening hopes for a breakthrough. Putin first proposed direct negotiations for May 15 over the weekend, but the Kremlin later announced he would not be attending.

title: Power corrupts, and absolute power corrupts absolutely’’: Sumanthiran responds to President
byline: Referring to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s statement on forming administrations in local councils, former MP M.A. Sumanthiran remarked that ’’power corrupts, and absolute power corrupts absolutely.’’

title: Fuel leaks into upper Kotmale reservoir after bowser overturns
byline: A fuel bowser carrying 13,000 liters of fuel has gone missing after overturning causing a significant spill into the Upper Kotmale Reservoir.

title: Seven new envoys to Sri Lanka present credentials to President
byline: Seven newly appointed foreign ambassadors to Sri Lanka presented their credentials to President Anura Kumara Disanayake today at the Presidential Secretariat, President’s Media Division (PMD)said.

title: No leadership issues when working together in local bodies
byline: Leadership issues will not arise in the collective approach which is to be adopted by opposition parties to govern local bodies where the NPP has become a minority, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Mujibur Rahman said today.

title: AI-powered CCTV and GPS systems to be introduced
byline: Long-distance buses in Sri Lanka will soon be equipped with GPS and CCTV systems powered by Artificial Intelligence (AI), Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Pillayan challenges his arrest, detention before Supreme Court
byline: Former Eastern Province Chief Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan alias Pillayan has filed a Fundamental Rights petition before the Supreme Court challenging his arrest in connection with the  abduction and disappearance of Professor Sivasubramaniam Ravindranath, a former Vice-Chancellor of the Eastern University.

title: TID probes Harak Kata’s allegations against Ex-Minister, IGP
byline: The Terrorism Investigation Division (TID) has launched an investigation into claims by underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka Wickremeratne, alias Harak Kata, who alleged that he is being detained in Tangalle after refusing to pay a Rs. 300 million bribe.

title: Cabinet nod to import salt
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a decision to permit the import of salt for both industrial and consumer use till June 10, 2025.

title: Three Sri Lankan entrepreneurs shine on Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia list
byline:
Sri Lanka celebrated a key milestone as three of its young and emerging entrepreneurs ; Yanika Amarasekera-Siyaguna, Charith N Silva, and Nikin Matharaarachchi have been named to the prestigious Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia 2025 list. 

 

Yanika Amarasekera-Siyaguna founded Silver Aislein 2019, Sri Lanka’s first online wedding registry platform.

title: University student fined for sharing nude photo
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today imposed a fine of Rs. 5,000 on a university student who pleaded guilty to sharing a nude photograph of a fellow female undergraduate to a WhatsApp group in exchange for Rs. 500.

title: Man injured in Police shooting during illicit liquor raid in Kalpitiya
byline: A 31-year-old man was injured after police opened fire during a raid on an illicit liquor den in Kalpitiya, Galle.

title: SJB General Secretary fails to attend today’s meeting but says committed to cause
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara said today that he was unable to attend the meeting of Opposition party General Secretaries held to discuss the formation of joint administrations in local bodies, due to unavoidable circumstances.

title: Government moves to address salt shortage as shipments expected this week
byline: The Trade Ministry has taken urgent measures to import sufficient stocks of salt in response to a developing shortage in the market, with shipments expected to arrive within the week, officials confirmed.

title: Rolls-Royce Phantom touches down in SL
byline: A brand-new Rolls-Royce Phantom Series 8 II, Bentley Bentayga and BMW M3 CS have officially arrived in Sri Lanka, marking the high-profile return of ultra-luxury vehicles following the recent easing of the vehicle import ban.
